title: 110_hr1619
content:
The Act may be cited as the "Model T Ford Automobile Commemorative Coin Act". The Congress acknowledges the significant impact of the Model T Ford, with over 15 million produced between 1908 and 1927. The Model T revolutionized personal mobility, economy, and social life in America, popularizing the assembly line production model and creating millions of middle-class jobs. It was manufactured in 20 countries worldwide, showcasing its global influence. In 1999, the Model T was chosen as the "Car of the Century" by automotive experts for its lasting impact. The 100th anniversary of the Highland Park Plant, where the assembly line was born, will be celebrated in 2010. In commemoration of the 100th anniversary of the Model T Ford Automobile, the Secretary of the Treasury shall mint and issue 500,000 $1 coins weighing 26.73 grams, with a diameter of 1.500 inches, and containing 90% silver and 10% copper. These coins will be legal tender and considered numismatic items. The coins minted under this Act will be emblematic of the Model T Ford and the assembly line, with inscriptions of "Liberty", "In God We Trust", "United States of America", and "E Pluribus Unum". The design will be selected by the Secretary after consultation with the Commission of Fine Arts and reviewed by the Citizens Coinage Advisory Committee. SEC. 5. ISSUANCE OF COINS.

Coins minted under this Act shall be issued in uncirculated and proof qualities starting on January 1, 2010, and no coins may be minted after December 31, 2010.

SEC. 6. SALE OF COINS. SEC. 6. SALE OF COINS.

Coins issued under this Act will be sold by the Secretary at a price including face value, required surcharge, and design/issuance costs. Bulk sales will be offered at a discount, and prepaid orders will receive a reasonable discount. All sales of coins minted under this Act will include a $10 surcharge per coin. The surcharges received will be distributed with up to half going to the Automobile National Heritage Area Partnership Inc. for Model T preservation and educational programs, and the other half to The Henry Ford for creating an endowment. Michigan, a National Historic Landmark, will receive funding for maintaining and expanding displays and developing educational programs related to the Model T Ford Automobile. Organizations receiving payments will be audited as per the requirements of the United States Code.
